function.name: state.set
function.description: **Crucial for multi-step tasks.** Saves a key-value pair to your working memory. Use this immediately after discovering information (like from a search) to ensure it is not lost in later steps. Overwrites existing keys.

key.description: The unique name for the piece of information, e.g., 'repo_url'.

value.description: The information to store (string, number, list, dict).

function.name: state.get
function.description: Recalls a specific value from your working memory. Check your memory with `state.list_keys` first to see what you've already stored. Use this to avoid re-doing work like searches.

key.description: The key of the information to retrieve.

function.name: state.append_to_list
function.description: Adds an item to a list in your working memory. Perfect for gathering results in a loop. For example, after getting an overview of an item, append it to a 'results' list.

key.description: The key of the list to append to.

item.description: The item to add to the list.

function.name: state.list_keys
function.description: **Your situational awareness tool.** Lists all keys you have saved in your working memory. Call this at the beginning of a step to see what information you already have before deciding what to do next.
